intro: Psychotria ambigua, commonly known as the "devil's breath" or "wild nightshade," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth. Due to its toxic properties, it is considered a dangerous plant in its natural habitat.
